alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:01PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Pike County through 130 PM EDT... At 100 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Coleman to Rockhouse. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jamboree, Coleman and Phelps around 105 PM EDT. Argo and Woodman around 110 PM EDT. Phyllis around 115 PM EDT. Toonerville, Mouthcard, Fedscreek and Biggs around 120 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
